Package com.example.omninventory

Class InventoryItem

java.lang.Object
com.example.omninventory.InventoryItem
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class InventoryItem extends Object implements Serializable
Class representing an item stored in the inventory. Holds all data stored in fields for each inventory item.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • InventoryItem

      public InventoryItem()
      Empty constructor that initializes all fields to default values.

    • InventoryItem

      public InventoryItem(String firebaseId, String name, String description, String comment, String make, String model, String serialNo, ItemValue value, ItemDate date, ArrayList<String> tags)
      Full constructor that initializes all fields of item.
      Parameters:
      firebaseId - ID of item to create.
      name - Name of item to create.
      description - Description of item to create.
      comment - Comment of item to create.
      make - Make of item to create.
      model - Model of item to create.
      serialNo - Serial number of item to create.
      value - Estimated value of item to create (an ItemValue).
      date - Date of purchase of item to create (an ItemDate).

  • Method Details

    • convertToHashMap

      public HashMap<String,Object> convertToHashMap()
      Convert fields of an InventoryItem into a HashMap for writing to Firebase. Note that item.firebaseId is not stored in the HashMap, as it is not written with the item data.
      Returns:
      A HashMap representing this InventoryItem that may be written to Firebase.

    • getTagsString

      public String getTagsString()
      A method to generate a space-separated list of #-preceded tags as a single string for display
      Returns:
      A String in the form "#[tag_1_name] #[tag_2_name] etc

    • addTag

      public void addTag(String tagName)
      Adds a new tag to this InventoryItem's ArrayList of tags.
      Parameters:
      tagName - The tag to add.

    • isSelected

      public boolean isSelected()
      For InventoryItems in the MainActivity item list, this returns a flag describing whether or not the item is currently selected (on a long press from the user).
      Returns:
      A Boolean, 'true' if the item is selected, 'false' if not.

    • setSelected

      public void setSelected(boolean isSelected)
      Sets the flag describing whether or not the item is currently selected in the list.
      Parameters:
      isSelected - A Boolean, 'true' if the item is selected, 'false' if not.

    • getFirebaseId

      public String getFirebaseId()
      Getter for the InventoryItem's ID in firebase (a randomly-generated string).
      Returns:
      InventoryItem's ID.
